result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse James Kopp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jesse James Kopp is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jesse James Kopp was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse James Kopp

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jesse James Kopp in court.  Attorney Anthony Pozorski in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja in court for Jesse James Kopp. Per agreement, defendant to plead to Count 1 with 30 days jail and court costs. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives his rights. Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 1. Counts 2 and 3 dismissed. State heard. Attorney Ocwieja heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 29 days jail with 21 days credit for time served, court costs and DNA.

Defendant Jesse James Kopp in court.  Attorney Anthony Pozorski in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja in court for Jesse James Kopp. Case is not resolved, trial date requested. State has no position on if 22CF25, 22CF104, and this case are all tried together. Court heard and will try all 3 cases together. Motions to be filed by July 25. Motion hearing and trial date set.

Defendant Jesse James Kopp in court.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja in court for Jesse James Kopp. Offer has been received but not resolved. Trial date requested. Attorney Ocwieja requests 22CF104 with Branch I be moved to Branch II with other cases. No objection by State. Court approves. Court suggests trying all cases together. Counsel to decide if cases will be tried together or separately. All cases set for status with Branch II.

Jury trial scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jesse James Kopp in court.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja in court for Jesse James Kopp. Walt Dresen sworn and testified. Exhibit #1: offered, received, and accepted. State asks Court to take judicial notice of Iowa County cases 20CF69 and 21CF118. Court takes notice. Cross. State heard and asks for matter to be bound over. Attorney Ocwieja objects to bind over and waives argument. Court binds matter over. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea(s). Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Jury trial scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Preliminary hearing on March 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jesse James Kopp appeared in court, Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja appeared by video for Jesse James Kopp, Attorney Lisa A. Riniker appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties and right to counsel. State requests cash bond with no contact provision. Attorney Ocwieja heard. Court sets bond at $150 cash with condition: No abusive or violent contact with victim. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. Preliminary hearing set before Branch II.
Defendant shall have no abusive or violent contact with Victim 1.
